intro: Senecio helianthus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Senecio helianthus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
